result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nenad Lukovic

records.addlTxt: Trial Order signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 9/28/22

3:22 PM Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Nenad Lukovic.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. 
Defense has received discovery and an offer.
Defense requests matter be set for trial.  
Jury trial expected to last 1 day.  Court will select an alternate juror.  Each side is entitled to 4 strikes.  Clerk to prepare a trial order.
Jury status hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on November 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Authorization to Appear, filed by Atty. Wolff
Amended Signature Bond signed by defendant on 8-17-22

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no violent contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to reside with Victim A.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

11:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary Caitlin Brejcha in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nenad Lukovic in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Nenad Lukovic. 
Defense is waiting for an offer.
Defense requests to modify bond.
Statements by the Defense.
Statement by Victim A.
Statements by the State.
Court grants request and order bond conditions modified to include: Defendant to have no violent contact with victim A.  Defendant is not to reside with Victim A.
Status hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status hearing on September 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Hearing on August 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on June 21, 2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

02:53 PM Defendant Nenad Lukovic in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern, as a friend of the court.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation to be reevaluated.  Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
